standards.label: Semantics of Business Vocabulary and Rules (SBVR)
standards.description: An OMG standard defining a formal vocabulary and rules framework for business semantics.

standards.label: Unified Modeling Language (UML)
standards.description: An OMG standard modeling language for specifying, visualizing, constructing, and documenting software system artifacts.

bibliographicResources.title: Agile Extension to the BABOK® Guide
bibliographicResources.description: A standard on the practice of business analysis in an agile context. Published jointly by IIBA® and the Agile Alliance®.
bibliographicResources.publisher: International Institute of Business Analysis™ (IIBA®) and Agile Alliance®

bibliographicResources.title: The Business Analysis Competency Model® Version 4
bibliographicResources.description: The Business Analysis Competency Model® version 4 identifies the behaviours and techniques associated with each level of business analysis performed at work. It assists readers in understanding the levels of competency in the business analysis profession and supports the four levels of IIBA’s Multi-level Competency-Based Certification program by highlighting key competency components associated with each business analysis task.

publishers.name: Object Management Group (OMG)
publishers.description: An international, open membership, not-for-profit technology standards consortium that develops enterprise integration standards for a wide range of technologies and industries.

publishers.name: International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA)
publishers.description: A non-profit professional association for business analysis professionals, providing certification, training, and resources for the business analysis community worldwide.

publishers.name: Project Management Institute (PMI)
publishers.description: A global professional organization for project management professionals, offering certifications, standards, and resources including the PMBOK Guide and PMI Guide to Business Analysis.

publishers.name: International Requirements Engineering Board (IREB)
publishers.description: A non-profit organization dedicated to establishing and improving requirements engineering as a professional discipline through certification, education, and research.

publishers.name: International Qualifications Board for Business Analysis (IQBBA)
publishers.description: An organization providing internationally recognized certification schemes for business analysts, focusing on standardizing business analysis qualifications globally.
